string.text: The base loyalty of cities to the owner.
Days until the city's loyalty to the new owner changes.
The amount by which the city's loyalty to the owner increases when the owner is in the city.
Needed loyalty which is required for the city's obedience to the owner.
The time until another revolt can arise in the same kingdom.
The base size of the revolt army.
This multiplier is multiplied by the prosperity of the cities. The result is added to the base size of the revolt army.
Enables/Disables the mechanics for Imperial Loyalty.
The amount of renown an imperial clan loses after a successful revolt.
Does the mechanic affects the player as well.
A multiplier that is multiplied by the difference between the initial and current number of cities in a kingdom.
Enables/Disables the mechanics for Independent Factions.
The amount of renown an independent faction gains after a successful revolt.
Enables/Disables the Revolts mechanics for Lucky Nation.
A random lucky nation from all possible kingdoms.
Civil War kingdoms inherit the wars of their original kingdom.
Relationship threshold above which vassals are unconditionally loyal to their liege lord.
Relationship threshold below which vassals consider a conspiracy against their liege lord.
Basic chance to become a conspirator before taking all other factors into account.
Increases the chance for vassals to become conspirators based on whether their friends want to conspire as well.
Increases the chance for vassals to become conspirators if both their liege lord and themselves are dishonorable.
Base chance for conspiracy leaders to declare war on their liege lord before all other factors are taken into account.
Decreases chance of declaring a war based on liege and Vassal generosity and mercy.
The amount by which relationships between Lords (positive and negative) change based on the civil war faction to which they belong.
Multiplier for relations change between lords and faction leaders.
Enables/Disables the output of detailed information.
Seeing you spend time at {SETTLEMENT}. Your subjects feel more loyal to you.
The people of {SETTLEMENT} seem to be content.
Flames of Revolt are slowly stirring in {SETTLEMENT}.
People are content with the current rule.
Many are inspired by tales of revolts in the kingdom.
Many are inspired by events at {SETTLEMENT}.
Some talk of raising banners of their homeland.
The people of this town had revolted recently and don't wish to spill blood again.
After hearing of blood spilled in {SETTLEMENT} citizens are afraid of revolting.
